summary: Grenada is an island country in the Caribbean Sea, known as the "Island of Spice" for its nutmeg and mace crops. It includes the main island of Grenada and smaller islands like Carriacou and Petite Martinique. Before Europeans arrived, indigenous peoples from South America lived there. Christopher Columbus saw Grenada in 1498. France colonized it in 1649, and Britain took over in 1763. Grenada gained independence in 1974 and is now a stable democracy with King Charles III as its head of state. It's a member of the Commonwealth of Nations.
title: Grenada
